content.description:
Taradiddle climbs an overhanging arete, on solid rock, over a good landing.

Sit start with a triangular left hand pinch-edge and a right hand edge down low. From there, stick a quick right hand to the start of

Gumption

, reel in the feet, match on it, then make a big move up, left to a great edge, match again, reach a left hand orifice, heel hook next to your right hand, then cross over to a right hand sidepull, reach a left hand edge, bump it further to the lip, commit to the face, and top it out using the edges on top for the send.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. I used three. The landing is pretty good, but there is a rock that divides the a fair amount of the land zone.
content.location:
It climbs the northeast arete of Solmar and shares some of the problem

Gumption

. Full value requires staying true to the east face the duration of the line.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the large, round feature at the arete. From there, make a toss up and left to an edge, match hands, throw a foot onto the start hold, leave the arete early to the right, reach the edges at the lip on the slab, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is good, but there is a rock that creates an uneven surface though.
content.location: It climbs the northeast arete of Solmar. Shares some of the same rock as the problem Taradiddle. Gumption begins with the much larger start hold and abandons the arete early for an easier finish.

content.description: Squat start with hands matched on a pair of incut edges at the horizontal seam. From there, make a big move to a sloping edge, match, reach the lip, and finish up and right (left exit is off) on the bumps and incuts.
content.protection: A pad or two will work. The landing is clear and flat.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Solmar.

climbs.name: Bikini Jones and The Termite Sisters

content.description:
Bikini Jones and The Termite Sisters climbs a trio of edges on a solid overhang over a perfect landing.

Squat start with hands on a pair of incut edges on the horizontal seam. From there, stick an incut right hand edge, hold the tension with a toe hook and cross under with the left to an edge next to the right hand, bump the right hand to a gaston, set the feet, make a big move to the lip, throw a heel up, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Solmar.
